description: The entire country is expected to experience the 50th heatwave since records began in 1947, according to the national weather agency, which placed 27 departments on yellow heat alert starting Thursday noon.

Tolerance holding up in France despite hate speech, report on racism finds
description: After a turbulent 2023 marked by the consequences of the terrorist attacks by Hamas, French people's acceptance of others again increased in 2024, according to the National Consultative Commission on Human Rights' annual study. But prejudice persists.

headline: Why the French economy is stuck in stagnation
description: GDP is not expected to grow by more than 0.6% in 2025, according to the latest economic outlook by France's national statistics institute. All drivers of economic activity have stalled and unemployment is projected to rise to 7.7% at the end of the year.

headline: Poland is attracting foreign tourists on a quest for a cool summer escape
description: As the season begins, more and more vacationers are flocking to the beaches along the Baltic Sea coast. In 2023, 19 million foreign travelers visited Poland, a figure that has been rising steadily.

headline: How close is Iran to having nuclear weapons?
description: Israel has bombed strategic sites in Iran, which it said could soon produce a nuclear weapon. Tehran had announced it was increasing its production of enriched uranium, amid stalled talks with the United States.
byline: Manon Romain,  Pierre Breteau and  Zoé Multeau

headline: Was the Trump phenomenon a historical accident? Reinterpreting the history of the American right
description: Convinced that political liberalism was deeply rooted in the US, American historians long downplayed the far right's influence within the conservative movement. In light of new historiography, Trump appears less a historical accident and more the result of a long gestation.
